title: Could we make Irelias stun duration scale on the Targets health difference agasint her?
body:
Irelias stun is frustrating to play against, that sums it up. You're punished for doing well against her. 

So what if we made Irelias stun duration based on the percent missing health difference between her and her target?

* If target has 1% - 20% higher health then Irelia, then the stun last for .75 seconds.
If the target has 21% - 40% then it stuns for 1 second
41% - 60% stuns for 1.5
61% - 99% stuns for 2.25

This would stop her from assassinating carries for doing one ranged auto against her, before she closes the gap, while keeping close battles against her fair, since in a 1v1, both of your healths should be declining, keeping them within a fair percentage.

This also helps her against opponents who are snowballing, since a well timed stun at low health could turn the battle for your team. That's just my thoughts at Irelia.

I don't think you see my point, if you think a max health Irelia, could assassinate a max health squishy, with a .75 second stun. The entire point is to make the stun more of a "Im being bursted, better even the fight" instead of "I took an auto first, sucks to be you".

The point of it is to even match ups with Irelia, and to stop her from being able to assassinate carries, while also becoming a sort of Anti-burst warrior, since if she is bursted down, she'll have a higher stun to even the fight.

Or, she is fighting harder as she's losing. Fits her entire 'determinator' gimmick.

It's a niche. It fits her as a character.

Points for choosing a lesser-seen target to complain about, though.

> Or, she is fighting harder as she's losing. Fits her entire 'determinator' gimmick.

For your second point, yeah it fits her theme... doesn't mean the stun itself is fair. 

For the first point though, when an Irelia stuns an adc, who has the same percent health as her, and proceeds to murder their face off, how is Irelia losing? How is having 1% more health than Irelia mean that Irelia is losing? The concept is fine, but its entirely unhinged in its point.
Why is Irelia the one champ that people think is busted for having a stun? Half the champs have some form of cc.

Its not the stun that is being complained about. Its the objective behind the stun. To stun, your opponent needs to be of higher health then you, therefore you are punished for doing well against her. 

Did you auto attack her first? Stunned. Did she take a bunch of minion agro then came for you? Stunned. Is it a close duel between you and her? Stunned?

The problem escalates when she starts diving your carries. Did you fire one, single auto attack against her? Well have fun getting stunned for 2 seconds straight, while she pummels away at your face.
I think of it as a stun that is punished for her doing good.

The issue is that in lane she doesn't have a weakness. You should never let someone like Irelia dictate when a fight is going to happen, but if you try to dictate the fight then you get punished by being stunned for 2 seconds during which time she can probably at least evenly trade the damage you dealt to her. You both disengage with even health (if you are lucky) which she immediately heals back. Now you have the disadvantage in lane and letting her choose when you fight could be fatal, but firing the first shot is still dangerous because if you damage her too much she stuns you and then gets a free kill.

With the proposed change it would make Irelia hard to force out of lane because even when low she has a long stun to even the tables, but when you are about even with her she no longer just auto-wins trades. The entire idea is that Irelia becomes more dangerous when behind, not insta-wins trades by getting hit first.

Uh, Irelia has a huge weakness in lane. It's called either a lane bully, or getting out scaled. Irelia is pretty firmly in the mid game territory. Champions like Olaf bully her all day, Maokai/Gnar out scale her, and now Fiora does both to her.

The proposed change would make Irelia even more useless than she currently is in the current meta.

Irelia has a 53%, 54%, 55%, and a whopping 65% win rate against Olaf, Gnar, Maokai, and Fiora respectively. I'll concede that the Fiora stats aren't representative yet because she hasn't been out long, but regardless Irelia wins more games than she loses against all the champs you just listed as "counters". Irelia is even listed as being Olaf's biggest counter so I'd say that regardless of your experiences with her statistically she is a lot stronger than you give her credit for.

http://champion.gg/champion/Irelia/Top

For everything else you max W-E-Q.
Always max Q last.

This change seems to contradict the rest of her kit. Everything else, except her q heals her, so the difference will be continually lowered as the fight continues. If her e duration doesn't scale on duration, then many Irelias would max their q second, which isn't good. Maxing the q second would make her initiation deal more damage and lower the difference in hp and make a smaller stun. If the e doesn't scale, it should probably be reworked in some other way. Also, in many cases, if there is a 61%-99% difference, the stun probably no longer matters. I would make it something like 61%-80% stuns for 2.0 and 81%-99% could stun for 2.5. But that still makes for a pretty small stun unless it doesn't matter.

> The Difference will be continually lowered as the fight continues. 

Slight difference, if Irelia is winning the fight, she doesn't get the stun at all. She's winning. But if you're winning, she gets to stun you and proceeds to win the trade herself. Are you beginning to see the problem here? 

The skill is called Equilibrium. The point of my suggested change is to make it less of, I win whether or not I'm ahead of a trade, and more of, I was losing a trade, but now we're on fair ground. Which, you guessed it would make it equal.

I think I like the idea of giving her increased healing on her w as the health difference increases instead of doing that with the stun and just changing the e entirely. Although that would change how the champion works. Balancing is difficult.

>If target has 1% - 20% higher health then Irelia, then the stun last for .75 seconds.
If the target has 21% - 40% then it stuns for 1 second
41% - 60% stuns for 1.5
61% - 99% stuns for 2.25

How would this work with ability ranks though?

At rank 1 would the 1-20% stun be shortened down to 0.375 seconds AKA nothing?

Would it just not scale with ranks and make ranking E completely worthless? Would that also make her slow duration 2.25 seconds on rank 1 E?

The idea isn't bad but there's still a lot of problems that would need to be solved. Also Irelia would still punish you for doing well against her, probably even more so than she does now.
I'd think that the stun duration would scale on the percent missing health difference alone, not with Levels. This promotes Irelias maxing something else first, while keeping close trades close.

It also has a side effect of making her level 9-13 even more prominent since she can effectively have max rank W and max rank E at level 9 and at 13 she has the 'full' effect from all of her abilities.
Have you seen Elise? A non-scaling cc is not a rarity.

Have you seen Elise's power curve? Having a non-scaling CC serves to make you more powerful early while becoming weaker into the late game.

Also Elise's E scales at 1.6/1.7/1.8/1.9/2

I think the idea is to not completely punish someone for BOTH of you being at max health or have close health. Considering most Irelias max E now it is very difficult to fight her in lane after level 7 due to an on demand stun that lasts 2 seconds and has no counterplay to. It's let her have higher health and then you die or you drop her health and then she stuns you and you die anyway.
As I mentioned somewhere else most Irelia's max W. It's 21.5 times more common to max W over E.
How about we just make it a goddamn 1 second stun at all ranks. Irelia maxing E is complete bullshit anyway. Her kit shouldn't even *have* a stun.

Would be a harsh nerf to Irelia, who is mainly a duelist and suffers in team fights.

If they reworked her E, and I do like the idea you put out, she would *need* something substantial.

-----

This sort of nerf makes it so that Irelia either never really gets her stun, or is just using it onto targets she isn't focusing or as an escape.

---

Currently, Irelia works well against champions who tend to do a lot of damage at the start of a trade, putting her lower than them, so she can stun them then use her Hiten Style to make the trade favorable with it's sustain/damage.
